channel.title: Opinion needed on a birthday present
channel.description:
This doesn't warrant its own thread, but its killing me... what the hell.
My architect brother's birthday is this week, and I got him a nice drafting pencil online. I also made a basswood box to put it in, but when the pencil arrived it came in a plastic retail package. Question: Should I gift it as-is, or tear the plastic off and put it in my box?
The plastic looks more legitimate, is unopened, and less likely to get damaged. The box however is easier to wrap and hell I made it.
[url=https://img200.imageshack.us/i/pencilv.jpg/][img]https://img200.imageshack.us/img200/562/pencilv.th.jpg[/img][/url] [url=https://img714.imageshack.us/i/pencilcase.jpg/][img]https://img714.imageshack.us/img714/5258/pencilcase.th.jpg[/img][/url] [url=https://img713.imageshack.us/i/caseg.jpg/][img]https://img713.imageshack.us/img713/5929/caseg.th.jpg[/img][/url]

item.title: Opinion needed on a birthday present
item.dc:creator: Combine
item.description:
The randomness that Ramirezoid pointed out was my biggest worry. But I’ll probably just use the box then, if not just gift both of them side by side. Thanks for the input.

Read full topic
item.source: Opinion needed on a birthday present

item.title: Opinion needed on a birthday present
item.dc:creator: doomyshadowsquirrels
item.description:
Go for the box, bro.

Read full topic
item.source: Opinion needed on a birthday present

item.title: Opinion needed on a birthday present
item.dc:creator: Ramirezoid
item.description:
Box might imply “Here’s a pen I found lying around. I put it in this box I made for something else, just so I’d have something to give you.”

I say expand the box’s girth a few cm

Read full topic
item.source: Opinion needed on a birthday present

item.title: Opinion needed on a birthday present
item.dc:creator: Samapico
item.description:
Box

Bonus if you can fit the pen in some foamy or soft casing so it doesn’t bang inside the box when it shakes. Or maybe just some soft cloth thing…
If the pen is already pretty tight in there, then nevermind.

Read full topic
item.source: Opinion needed on a birthday present

item.title: Opinion needed on a birthday present
item.dc:creator: eateroftheflame
item.source: Opinion needed on a birthday present

item.title: Opinion needed on a birthday present
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
Box. Plastic casing (especially the kind shown) is a fucking bitch to open. Save the dude the trouble.

Read full topic
item.source: Opinion needed on a birthday present

item.title: Opinion needed on a birthday present
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
neither

people don’t deserve gifts, since I never got any

Read full topic

item.title: Opinion needed on a birthday present
item.dc:creator: Shepard
item.description:
The box looks stylish, so defiantly i advise it. Also, for a pleasant memory, every birthday party member can left his/her sign on it.

Read full topic
item.source: Opinion needed on a birthday present

item.title: Opinion needed on a birthday present
item.dc:creator: Piefish
item.description:
The box, THE BOX

Read full topic
item.source: Opinion needed on a birthday present

item.title: Opinion needed on a birthday present
item.dc:creator: szparrow
item.description:
Go with the box. Hell, you made it for him, it’s like a present itself. Bet he will appreciate it.

Read full topic
item.source: Opinion needed on a birthday present

item.title: Opinion needed on a birthday present
item.dc:creator: BrAndi
item.description:
OrderOfDagon:

I say that you give him them both together and tell him that when he is not using it to put it into the box. Dont just give him a random pen. The gift is kinda low key anyway. Buy him some shoes or a jacket or something.

Yees, jacket and shoes show how well he knows his brother and how he supports his choice of profession.
I prefer something self made over some Nike shit any day.

I think it’s a nice idea. Why don’t you paint something on the box? Like a white background and a grid, or some kind of tower.

Read full topic
item.source: Opinion needed on a birthday present

item.title: Opinion needed on a birthday present
item.dc:creator: Deathmonkey7
item.description:
In the box. Also, make it look nice inside the box. Wrap a small ribbon around the pencil. Wrap the box nicely. Giving him a gift that is more personalized would mean more to him than handing him something in packaging.

Also, I would suggest using a wood burner to burn his initials into the box.

Read full topic
item.source: Opinion needed on a birthday present

item.title: Opinion needed on a birthday present
item.dc:creator: OrderOfDagon
item.description:
I say that you give him them both together and tell him that when he is not using it to put it into the box. Dont just give him a random pen. The gift is kinda low key anyway. Buy him some shoes or a jacket or something.

Read full topic
item.source: Opinion needed on a birthday present

item.title: Opinion needed on a birthday present
item.dc:creator: bobbo
item.description:
Box, but wrap it up nicely so it doesn’t bounce around in the box.

Read full topic
item.source: Opinion needed on a birthday present

item.title: Opinion needed on a birthday present
item.dc:creator: papernick
item.source: Opinion needed on a birthday present

item.title: Opinion needed on a birthday present
item.dc:creator: GilCMassey
item.description:
Depends. Does the pencil fit in the box while it is wrapped in plastic? If so, go that route. But, if you are more traditional like my family, unwrap it and put it into the box. After all, you made it, and (btw) baywood is a nice wood indeed. Good choice.

EDIT: Damn. Scratch what I said. Stupid me, obviously it won’t fit. Meh, I say undo the package and put it in the box. If the box was done right, it shouldn’t break.

Read full topic
item.source: Opinion needed on a birthday present
